category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
GLORIOUS GOD, You're a God who keeps His promises.
All of Your promises in Jesus Christ are a solid "yes,"
and they will all come true.
You have spoken them, so they will be done.
You've commanded them, so they will happen.

And yet, I have often doubted them.
I have lived at times as if there were no God.
Lord, forgive me for that "death in life"—
for the times I've found my purpose in something other than You,
for when I've been satisfied with temporary things.

But through Your grace, I've turned back.
You've let me see my pardon in the wounds of Jesus,
and my soul trusts in Him—my God who became human,
the foundation of my life, the source of my hope.

Teach me to surrender to Your will,
to find joy in Your ways,
to have no will but Yours,
and to believe that everything You do is for my good.
Help me to leave my worries in Your hands,
because You have power over evil and can bring endless good out of it,
until Your purposes are complete.

Bless me with a faith like Abraham's—
one that doesn't waver at Your promises because of unbelief.
Help me not to boss You around in my troubles,
but to glorify You in my trials.

Help me to take a clear step forward in my spiritual life.
I want to reach a higher level,
leave the fog of doubt and fear behind,
and climb to the high ground of eternal security in Christ,
by simply believing that He cannot lie or give up on His purpose.

Give me the confidence I should have in Him,
who is worthy of all praise and is blessed forever.
